div.div: ἅρπυια : harpy, ‘snatcher;’ the horses of Achilles had Zephyrus as sire and the harpy Podargē as dam, Il. 16.150; usually pl., ἅρπυιαι: supernatural powers, by whom those who had mysteriously disappeared were said to have been snatched away (perhaps a personification of storm-winds), Od. 1.241.
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
